author: Special Correspondent
text:
An illicit affair of a 50-year-old woman reportedly snuffed out the life of a 21-year-old girl, P. Rajalakshmi, whose decomposed body was found under Austinpatti police station limits on February 13.

The police identified the girl’s aunt S. Shanti, a widow, and her lover M. Saravanan (31), a married man, as perpetrators of the crime.

Superintendent of Police Vijayendra Bidari said that the motive for the murder was to snatch a gold chain and ear studs, weighing over two sovereigns, from the girl to meet some urgent needs of Saravanan, whose wife was a police constable.

Gold recovered

The police had recovered the gold and arrested the two. “We have to further investigate to find out whether some more accused are involved in the crime,” the SP said.

A special team led by Tirupparankundram Deputy Superintendent of Police Ramasamy cracked the case. Austinpatti police had registered a case of girl missing in West Street at Uchapatti on Feburary 12 after their search for the girl on the previous day went in vain.

The police said that Shanti, whose son was also a police constable, invited the deceased to her house for stitching a sari on February 11. When the girl came to Shanti’s house, which was adjacent to hers, the woman attacked her and gagged her.

Wrapped

After strangulating the girl, she wrapped her with a gunny bag.
title: Aunt, her lover held for girl’s murder
